required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Title: Povidone-soaked Sutures Versus Ordinary Sutures for Reducing Surgical Site Infection
clinical_study.official_title: Title: Povidone-soaked Sutures Versus Ordinary Sutures for Reducing Surgical Site Infection: Randomize Control Trial Study in General Surgery Cases of Hospital Universiti Sains Malaysia

brief_summary.textblock: To determine efficacy of using 3 minutes povidone-soaked suture in reducing surgical site infection during wound closure in elective surgery.

detailed_description.textblock:
Participant recruitment and randomisation based on eligibility based on CONSORT.
Patient will get either package A or B which determine whether they are getting povidone-soaked suture or ordinary suture during wound closure.
Postoperative, follow up on D10 and D30 of patient well being and signs and symptoms of surgical site infection

primary_outcome.measure: Povidone-soaked Sutures versus Ordinary Sutures for Reducing Surgical Site Infection: Randomize Control Trial Study in General Surgery Cases of Hospital Universiti Sains Malaysia
primary_outcome.description: There is difference of outcome using povidone-soaked suture and ordinary suture. In this study, our hypothesis the suture with povidone-soaked will reduce the SSIs rate during closure and it will be assessed on day 10 and day 30 post-operative. Few measurement are used in detection of SSI based on clinical and biochemical measurement such as signs of inflammation and total white cell count.

secondary_outcome.measure: Povidone-soaked Sutures versus Ordinary Sutures for Reducing Surgical Site Infection: Randomize Control Trial Study in General Surgery Cases of Hospital Universiti Sains Malaysia
secondary_outcome.description: There is association between povidone-soaked suture and ordinary suture in reducing surgical site infection. There is difference of outcome using povidone-soaked suture and ordinary suture. In this study, our hypothesis the suture with povidone-soaked will reduce the SSIs rate during closure and it will be assessed on day 10 and day 30 post-operative. Few measurement are used in detection of SSI based on clinical and biochemical measurement such as signs of inflammation and total white cell count.

secondary_outcome.measure: Povidone-soaked Sutures versus Ordinary Sutures for Reducing Surgical Site Infection: Randomize Control Trial Study in General Surgery Cases of Hospital Universiti Sains Malaysia
secondary_outcome.description: There is difference in the extent of intervention needed to manage SSIs in wounds closed with povidone-soaked suture and ordinary suture. This hypothesis measure how far that the management of SSIs whether non-operative or operative treatment is needed. This is base on antibiotic use, dressing and surgical intervention such as debridement.

clinical_study.condition: Efficacy Povidone Soaked Suture in Reducing Surgical Site Infection

arm_group.description: The patient is randomized, those with povidone-soaked suture group will be prepared for povidone-soaked suture during wound closure. The absorbable suture will be soaked into povidone for 3 mins before the wound closure.
the patient is randomized, those with ordinary suture group will proceed with wound closure as usual manner following the standard practice.

intervention.description: suture soak with povidone solution for 3 mins
suture no need to soak with povidone solution

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age more than 12 years old
- Clean surgery or Clean- contaminated surgery
- Elective surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age less than 12 years old
- Contaminated wound
- Dirty wound
- Allergy to povidone-iodine
- Pregnant
- Laparoscopic
- Emergency surgery
